creator: KGolomb@TradeCard.com
text:
apr_file_mktemp in mktemp.c checks if the temporary files exists by checking the
return code against APR_EEXIST instead of using APR_STATUS_IS_EEXIST(s).  So an
OS that returns an error code for the files existing like WIN32 will return the
Error code ERROR_FILE_EXISTS (80) back to the caller saying the file exist for
creating a temporary file if the file exists.  Changing this to the macro should
fix this error condition.

patch for mktemp.c

145c145
<         if (rv != APR_EEXIST)
---
>         if (!APR_STATUS_IS_EEXIST(rv))

creator: KGolomb@TradeCard.com
text:
Created attachment 19041
Patch to fix the file exists issue
Committed to trunk in r468055.  Thanks!
creator: rooneg@electricjellyfish.net

text:
Note that I also backported this to the 0.9.x and 1.2.x branches, so it should
make it into the next release.
